fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43367].
  {panel}

Hi,
   Recently I had an issue about the Postgres JDBC driver and I found an inconsistence at JIRA documents.
   The standalone installation of JIRA does not require changing the JDBC driver if JIRA is not WAR (Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL]), but the [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] document says or seems to say that he DB version should match the JDBC version. This information is causing some noise at the customers and took me some time to understand what should I do. I think is important to clear this out to reduce this friction.

   I'm not sure about the solution. Maybe is recommend leave the old JDBC 9.0 with newer versions of Postgres since this is the bundle driver or is recommend follow the JIRA war process to install the JDBC new driver. The comment from James Rice (at references below) resumes this inconsistence.
   
   References for this request:
   * Issue [JSP-231367|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-231367];
   * James Rice comment at Jan 28, 2015 from [Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL] page.

Thanks a lot,
Daniel P Santos
fields.summary: Inconsistent documentation about not changing Postgres JDBC driver for JIRA standalone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43365].

Dear Team,

It is very annoying to give all users to create Dahsboards, performance wise and management wise.

We are currently having problem with one big client almost 20000 user so if each one decided to create a dashboard with refresh interval each 2h will harm the system.

What do you think ?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43350].
  {panel}

*Summary*

Custom Field Wiki Style Renderer Has *User Mention* Button Which Custom Field Doesn't Support Mention In The First Place

Step to reproduce:

- Create a custom field with *Text Field (multi-line)*
- Assign to any screen
- Navigate to *Field Configuration* page (or press "gg" and search for Field Configuration)
- Click on *Configure* button on any field configuration that contained your custom field.
- Navigate to your custom field and click on "Renderers" button.
- Choose *Wiki Style Renderer*
- The custom field will look like the below image:
* !add user mention menu option.png|thumbnail!

In conclusion, *User Mention* button does not belong in that custom field since custom field does not support mention. There is a [feature request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32563] for this case.
fields.summary: Custom Field Wiki Style Renderer Has User Mention Button Which Custom Field Doesn't Support Mention In The First Place
Documentation Request - Add OAuth section to AppLinks documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43348].
  {panel}

Hello,
There are a few actions that I need to restrict to a certain group of people (mostly editing some specific fields in my case, but I'm sure this request could help in other situations).

To achieve this I'd like to be able to create a global (as in available from all statuses) transition that doesn't change the status (or dynamically picks the source status as target status).
And then set the appropriate screen and conditions etc.

Thanks,
JG
fields.summary: Global transitions that don't change the status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43346].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
- Customer has 2 groups of users that can view an issue.
-* One group is like the users, they can create, view and edit issues, however, they cannot transition issue to a new state.
-* Second group involves users who can work on issues and then transition them to new states.
- Customer is aware that they can do this manually by setting conditions and the likes in Workflow, however since they have lots of workflows, this would not be scalable especially when it involves changing the group with permission to transition issues, they would need to do this for approximately 30 statuses while having roughly a hundred Workflows in their JIRA instance.

Can a feature be added that helps optimize how a Workflow can be modified easily based on the scenario described above?
fields.summary: Workflow Transition based on User Role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43340].
  {panel}

When creating quick setup you have added soy templates for quick setup to every JIRA page.
The context responsible for that is js-soy-templates.
Please create separate context only for your requests and require it accordingly.
This is affecting significantly JIRA performance adding 57kB to each page.
fields.summary: Setup soy templates included on every page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43337].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Users are unable to log into JIRA, receive a "Webpage has a redirect loop" error in browser

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.5-OD-03-002 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User logs into instance with their Username/Password
# After a few seconds, they receive an error indicating that the page has a redirect
!Redirect.png|thumbnail!

If User modifies the URL (for example: instanceurl/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) they can access the instance however when they click on the JIRA Home button, they receive another redirect indicating instanceurl/servicedesk/agent/onboarding. 

h3. Expected Results
Customer is able to login and access the JIRA Dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Upon login, page generates a Redirect Loop Error and does not load
 
h3. Workaround
Adding the affected User(s) to Service Desk Agents group, letting them login, and then remove them from Service Desk Agents group
fields.summary: Users are unable to log into Instance Receive Redirect Loop Error in Browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43329].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the only way to drop the user session is by restarting the application.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if we could do this trough the UI like we have in Crowd:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Managing+a+User's+Session

This feature could be added to the [Active User Sessions page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Viewing+User+Sessions] so that any active sessions could be easily terminated by a JIRA Admin.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, I would like to be able to terminate a user session through the JIRA UI
Multiple task assignment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43327].
  {panel}

We have recently added some validators in our workflow, eg:
1.  only project leader (project role) is allowed to approved / accept an issue.
2. all sub-tasks need to be closed before resolved (which I think should be default design)

The problem is when the validators is not fullfilled the user gets no information, ie
1. workflow buttom is hidden when not in the user not in project role
2. when all sub-tasks is not closed, buttom to resolve is hidden

This is confusing and causes user to try to understand themselves what is wrong.

My proposals are
1. As a user I would like to see buttons for all transistions, and the ones I am not allowed to do is greyed out
2. As a user I would like to get a warning that not all sub-tasks are closed, and not possible to resolve.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see buttons for all transistions and not allowed ones greyed out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43320].

h3. Problem Definition
Custom field is set to be available context for a particular project (i.e.: MOGA). During basic search, custom field is shown with "grey" option and with a warning message "<custom field name> is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type". Customer wants to hide the field completely in basic search function for security reason.

h3. Suggested Solution
Hidden fields should not be shown during basic search.
fields.summary: Hide custom fields that is not associated with the project in basic search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43307].
  {panel}

Scenario tested:
* User limit not reached prior to import: DefaultProjectImporterManager spawns one thread per new user, all (or most) threads conclude that are seats available and add the new users to jira-use group, exceeding the license on the way.
* User limit reached prior to import: If the user limit was reached before the import all threads conclude there are no seats available and no user is added to the jira-use group.

This behaviour is not consistent, project import should be able to exceed the license or not regardless of previous state.

It happens both with roles enabled and disabled
fields.summary: Project import can exceed number of users only if the limit was not reached beforehand
Update Portal Logo Change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43303].
  {panel}

In JIRA Service Desk we programmatically set an issue property to indicate that the issue came in through the "portal" or via "email" say.

We can find these issues  with JQL like

issue.property["request.channel.type"].value = "portal" 

This works as expected.

However if we want to find all issues where there is no property set then it does not work

issue.property["request.channel.type"].value is empty

returns nothing.  

I have an expectation that it would show all issues without the request.channel.type property set.
fields.summary: Issue properties in JQL fail to respect is empty

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43302].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
I would like to restrict status changes in issues so that only the assignee can act upon them. Although this can be completed using conditions in workflow statuses, editing all transitions for every workflow can be time consuming and hard to maintain.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to accomplish this function more easily such as a GUI checkbox in a project/workflow.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add conditions in workflows to only allow assignees to transition issues.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to restrict transitions in issues without having to use advanced workflow configurations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43284].
  {panel}

Hi,
I cannot find how to create a Feature Request so I hope this is the correct location.

As a user of JIRA to respond to customer tickets, I often find I'm doing the same tasks over and over. For example, when I set a ticket to Customer, I fill in the same Comment, set the Date to the currrent value and then click Customer. When I cancel a ticket, I set the same values every time and then click Cancel.

Wouldn't it be great to have a single button or link that I could press (perhaps in a sidebar) that would do it all for me?

I have not found anything similar after a quick search. There are references to default templates and some rule automation in Confluence and the Cloud but that's not what I'm looking for. I want to be able to define an action or default values in multiple fields whenever I click a button or link.

Can this functionality be added?

Many thanks,
Denis.
fields.summary: Create buttons or macros for frequent tasks

*Problem Definition*

*Suggested Solution*

fields.summary: Enable users to export all the events in Audit Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43280].
  {panel}

I am trying to use our instance of JIRA for asset management. I have two tables, one for service users, one for assets. I am using links to identify those assets being used by a user.
When I create a link and add a comment (Link Asset-7224 to User-869), that is fine. It shows the comment on the Asset, and that there is a link on the user (if I look at "ALL" in the activitiy of the issue).
However, If I go to the asset and delete the link to the user, what shows is
ASSET HISTORY: Admin made changes - 8 minutes ago
                              Link 	This issue alloc'd to USER-869 [ USER-869 ] 	 
USER HISTORY:  Admin made changes - 9 minutes ago
                              Link 	This issue alloc'd to ASSET-7224 [ ASSET-7224 ]

Additionally, if I go to the user record (user-869) and then use the Activity tab within Activity on the issue (as it's a little prettier), it tells you 
    "Admin: Admin removed the Link of USER-869 - JO HARDMAN
                 Core10 minutes ago"
But that is not what has happened. What has happened is the deletion of the link to Asset-7224. It makes no sense making the Activity bit unusable, and the ALL bit unusable.

Why does the ALL tab not say that the link is removed? or the ACTIVITY tab not say what has been removed?  We need to keep a history of the links for the whole service desk. Any advice would be appreciated as at present, this is unworkable and we may need to look at another solution.
(see attached for examples of what the ALL and ACTIVITY tabs show for each issue being linked/link removed.)
fields.summary: Link deletion shows as change but not deletion.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43279].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When using JIRA external activity stream gadget integrated with Confluence and 2LO with impersonation, the "Login & Approve" prompt still appears. When using Trusted Applications, the prompt doesn't appear and loads normally. 

Atlassian recommends using 2LO with impersonation and is mandatory for integration with JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
When using JIRA Issues Macro, this doesn't require the "Login & Approve" prompt. The external gadgets should do the same and acknowledge the impersonation so that the prompt is not required.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use Confluence's Activity Stream gadget.
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream Gadget Prompts "Login & Approve" using OAuth with Impersonation
Use Foreground Indexing during Index Recovery?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43275].
  {panel}

In some cases a JIRA user may not understand that he needs to escape special characters in a JIRA JQL when using special characters, such as {{?}}, {{*}}.

It would be nice if we had a better mention in our documentations for JIRA Search filters:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Filters
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Searching+for+Issues
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching
Advising that some text filters may not work because of the special character not escaped.

A link to this documentation may prevent friction:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-Escapingspecialcharacters:\or\\
fields.summary: Improve "Search Filter" documentations regarding special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43274].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there is no method for JIRA to perform any data validation/detection when it comes to checking the integrity of the data within JIRA. As a result, whenever there is any problems with the integrity of the data within JIRA, it does not get detected beforehand. As a result, sometimes the problem is only detected when it's too late (for example, when upgrading).

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we have some sort of method or tool that can detect and validate the integrity of the data in an instance. This way many data integrity issues can be detected early and solved. The current Integrity Checker does not seem to be able to detect these issues. Perhaps a health check tool instead?
fields.summary: As an admin, I want JIRA to be able to detect/validate data integrity of the instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43263].
  {panel}

As an administrator I would like the ability to hide child groups when using nested groups with my LDAP connector

Example use case:
* I have a large number of users spread out across multiple regions
* Users are members of regional groups
* I would to add my regional groups to a single jira-users group and have this group show up in JIRA, and all users in the regional member groups receive the jira-users group in JIRA.
* I do not want or need JIRA to show the regional groups. I only want the parent jira-users group
fields.summary: Ability to hide child groups when using nested user groups
Add reference to Running SQL commands in a HSQL database documentation to the Retrieving the JIRA Administrator documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43260].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When modifying a Workflow Scheme, the following error is displayed: "A issue type with ID ‘10200’ does not exist"
 !issue_type.jpeg! 

*Cause:*
The Issue Type has been deleted but it is still linked to the workflow.

h3. Environment
This is the most up to date JIRA Cloud environment, but is likely present on JIRA Server as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete any issue type for that is being used by an active workflow.
# Attempt to edit the workflow scheme.

h3. Expected Results
Workflow scheme is editable.

h3. Actual Results
You will encounter an error similar to "A issue type with ID '10200' does not exist.
The ID will be different but the error message will be the same.
 
h3.Workaround
* Recreate the Workflow Scheme from scratch (not Copy scheme as the copy contains the corruption) and reassign Projects to that new Scheme.
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Workflow Scheme with error Issue Type does not exist
Rename "Move All Sub-tasks" to something that matches its behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43258].
  {panel}

We're running JIRA with the Agile/Scrum plugin.  During a sprint, sometimes the scope or nature of a story changes due to new requirements or discoveries.  We sometimes need to move a portion of a story's sub-tasks in to a new one, and push it in to our backlog.

The current process involves:

# Creating the story or stories we need to move the sub-tasks too (unless they already exist, which is rare).
# Navigating to the story that hosts the sub-tasks we need to move.
# Select the "More \ Move All Sub-tasks" feature
# Select the sub-tasks to move
# Select the story to move them to
# Then select "Move Sub-tasks"

A simpler experience would be not to create the target stories in preparation of the move.  Rather just create the story inline with the move process:

#...
# Select the sub-tasks to move
# Select "Create a new story"
# Then select "Move Sub-tasks"
# Present the "Create" pop-up window
# Create the story and save

This helps keep the team workflow in line with the conversation and simplifies the overall effort.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to create new stories while moving sub-tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43255].
  {panel}

When starting a new instance of latest JIRA, a 12 step tour is proposed to discover the functionalities of the app. Unfortunately it does not seem to be skippable. Although a good intention, making this unskippable is quite the annoyance when you are a knowledgeable user simply setting up a brand new instance.

Adding a skip button would be appreciated.

*Workaround:*
# As a JIRA administrator, navigate to _<JIRA-URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_
# Add the following dark feature flag: _jira.onboarding.feature.disabled_
fields.summary: 'Welcome To JIRA' tour

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Administering+Bitbucket+and+GitHub+with+JIRA

What I'm keen to suggest is that this includes some sort of 'merge' facility when it launches everything done with my Bitbucket user can be merged to my OnDemand account and I can remove the second user.

I'm sure this is on the map already, but am keen that it is included.
fields.summary: Link JIRA OnDemand with Bitbucket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43240].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Bamboo Gadgets Load Blank on JIRA Dashboard

h3. Environment
JIRA v6.5-OD-03-002

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit Dashboard
# Add Bamboo Gadgets (Bamboo Charts, Bamboo Plan Summary, Bamboo Plans, or Clover Coverage)
# Gadget does not show information; displays a blank box
#- Other non-bamboo gadgets are unaffected

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo Gadget loads its information on dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Seeing errors in Chrome Console view:
{noformat}Uncaught TypeError: AJS.gadget.bamboo.getConfigTheme is not a function{noformat}
{noformat}Uncaught TypeError: AJS.namespace is not a function{noformat}
{noformat}Uncaught TypeError: AJS.gadget.bamboo.getConfigTheme is not a function{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43233].
  {panel}

Background:

When using an internal user directory with delegated LDAP authentication, a user record is typically not created in JIRA until the user logs in for the first time, which makes it difficult (impossible) to modify permissions on users in advance.

Suggestion:

Provide a an option (check box) to "force authenticate" users so admin can modify user permission, assigning issues in advance
fields.summary: Provide option to Force authenticate users in JIRA with Delegated LDAP authentication
Excel export should remove wiki markups from fields with Wiki Style Renderer
Project Specific Announcements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43226].
  {panel}

I suggest that to help the users quicker understand content in dashboard possiblity for dashbboard onwer to:
1) add a free text describing the dashboard (new gadget).
2) add gadget titles (free text) 
3) default text for some gadget can be removed, e.g.  "Filter Results", "Two Dimenional Filter Result", "Pie Chart", is of absolutely no interest to the user (who looks at Dashboard), and can be be removed. 

Maybe the user could chose between showing gadget default title or creats its own.

--

Rational: 
The dashboard user needs information what content is showed in the gadget. 
Previsouly I did be given by chosing the name of filter visely (this is no long possible refer to JIRA-42723. In 6.2 and ealier, I gave the filter a name like "Project Name - Defects - priority distribution", and that was shown as a "title").

From a user point of view I think the current default text, e.g.  "Filter Results", "Two Dimenional Filter Result", "Pie Chart", is of absolutely no interest to the user (who looks at Dashboard), and can be be removed.
fields.summary: Improve dashboard usiblity by adding free text gadget titles and dashboard description text
Update 6.4 Stable to bundle Issue Nav Components 6.5.5
Isse Nav Button background on a slow internet connection goes into repeat mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43220].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 30 July 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}

Hey guys!

With the release of Windows 10 and Microsoft Edge there are surely customers who are interested in knowing when JIRA (and our other products) will support Microsoft Edge. 

Atlassian fully intends to support Microsoft Edge and are working to do so in a reasonable timeframe. We should see Edge support coming to JIRA in Q4 2015 at the earliest. Circumstances may change this timeframe in the coming months, and if so I will make sure I keep everyone watching this issue in the loop.
 
Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Kind Regards,

Kerrod Williams
[kwilliams@atlassian.com|mailto:kwilliams@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

Request for inclusion of [Microsoft Edge|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/browser-for-doing] in JIRA supported platform.
fields.summary: Support Microsoft Edge Browser for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43218].
  {panel}

According to [Specify your license key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+the+Setup+Wizard#RunningtheSetupWizard-Step3.Specifyyourlicensekey], there're 3 ways to enter a license key:
# register an Atlassian ID and get a license key, if the user doesn't have an account yet
# sign in with Atlassian ID and get a license key, if the user already has an account
# manually enter a license key, if the user already has a license key
{panel}(i) Among these, Server ID is only displayed if the user selects method 3, which doesn't really make sense as the user already has a license key and simply needs to enter the key without caring about the Server ID.{panel}

In some cases, users already have an account but no key, and for some reason method 2 does not work for them (probably network issue). Due to this, they manually log in https://my.atlassian.com and click to generate a New Evaluation License, where they're asked to provide a Server ID. At this step, Server ID is nowhere to be found if users are not curious enough to click to see method 3, where it is displayed.

*Suggestion*
{panel}Server ID should be displayed explicitly at Specify Your License Key step in the Setup Wizard, no matter which method is selected.{panel}

*Notes*
On https://my.atlassian.com/license/evaluation, the guide to get Server ID seems to be obsolete, showing an old Setup Wizard where Server ID was explicitly presented:
!serverid.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the way Server ID is presented in the Setup Wizard
Add a female avatar silhouette for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43216].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Browse Users permissions defaults to JIRA-Developers on a new install.  We would like service-desk-agents to automatically be added when Service Desk is installed on an instance so that those users can perform @mentions and browse users. 

h3. Workaround 
- Manually Update Global Permissions to include service-desk-agents
-or -
- Add service-desk-agents to jira-developers group
fields.summary: Add service-desk-agent Group to Browse User Global Permission on Install of Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43211].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce.

1. Download the JIRA 6.4.3 source distribution from www.atlassian.com 
2. {{gunzip atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source.tar.gz && tar -xvf atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source.tar}}
3. {{unzip dependencySources/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.33-sources.jar}} 

h2. Expected Behaviour

I expect to see an exploded folder containing all the sources files from [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin/src/jira-inline-issue-create-parent-0.3.3/plugin/src/main/scala/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/issue/create/]

h2. Actual behaviour

The contents of the sources jar is missing the compiled Scala files

{noformat}
 yeah-yeah in ~/Downloads/jira-source/atlassian-jira-6.4.3-source/dependencySources/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.3.3-sources
○ → ls -la
total 176
drwxr-xr-x    8 jclark  staff    272 May  1 13:39 .
drwxr-xr-x  331 jclark  staff  11254 May  1 13:39 ..
drwxr-xr-x    4 jclark  staff    136 Apr 14 13:26 META-INF
drwxr-xr-x    3 jclark  staff    102 Apr 14 13:25 analytics
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff  11925 Apr 14 13:25 atlassian-plugin.xml
drwxr-xr-x    6 jclark  staff    204 Apr 14 13:25 inline-issue-create
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff  70258 May  1 13:39 jira-inline-issue-create-plugin-0.3.3-sources.jar
-rw-r--r--    1 jclark  staff    738 Apr 14 13:25 jira-inline-issue-create-plugin.properties
{noformat}
fields.summary: Scala source files are missing from the jira-inline-issue-create-plugin source jar
Allow users to import private workflows from Marketplace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43208].
  {panel}

We're using JIRA 6.4.1.  Currently, JIRA uses relative dates for the first 7 days, then switches to absolute dates.  We would like to be able to configure the number of days before converting to absolute dates.  For example, it would be nice to set this to only 3 days.  It would also be nice to be able to change this setting on a per-user basis.

We know that it's possible to [disable relative dates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+Relative+Dates+in+JIRA] completely, but that doesn't get what we want.  We are also aware that hovering over the relative date shows the absolute date.  Again, this isn't quite enough and requires action from the user as opposed to being able to quickly glance at a screen to see the right level of information.

What we'd like is :
# To be able to set a User Default value for the number of relative days before converting to absolute dates.  
# To allow users to override this preference individually in their profile.
# To allow users to effectively disable relative dates by setting the preference to {{0}} days, meaning always show absolute dates.

*NOTE:* This is in addition to the request to [Display Relative Dates with Times|JRA-42780]
fields.summary: Configure Relative Date Display Preferences

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43207].
  {panel}

We have some components that have adopted this naming convention:

abc:orange
abc:apple
abc:grape

You can't partial patch by typing "apple" because the client-side javascript only seems to tokenize the words by spaces. Can we include non-alpha characters too?
fields.summary: Autocomplete fields should partial match on non-alpha characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43206].
  {panel}

As an user, when I click in one point of the chart in the *Average Number of Times in Status* gadget, I would like to see a list of the issues associated with that point in the chart. Today, when I click in one point, I will just be redirected to a search with the filter or project I have configured in the gadget associated with the period I set up.

When I click in the point in this chart I should see only one issue:
!number_of_times_gadget.png|thumbnail!

but I see this:
!filter_time.png|thumbnail!

Average Number of Times in Status is provided by the JIRA Charting plugin.
fields.summary: Better results after clicking in a plot point in the Average Number of Times in Status gadget.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43198].
  {panel}

In the page *Configuring JIRA Options* there are couple of options which are not configurable in JIRA Cloud and that does confuse the customer.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUD/Configuring+JIRA+Options

h3. Options that are not configurable in JIRA Cloud

# General Settings: Mode 
This is only configurable in user management page : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Enabling+Self+Sign+Up
# General Settings: CAPTCHA on signup
# Options : Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy
# Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed

h3. Suggestion 
We should include the line "(info) This option is not available for JIRA Cloud." for the features listed above.
fields.summary: Configuring JIRA Options documentation in Cloud Space need to be updated
Second dialog of the Issue nav feature discovery is misaligned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43196].
  {panel}

1. Create a task.
2. Create subtasks A, B and C
3. Move B up so that the order is B, A, C
4. Run the search REST API method with jql=key=<issue key>
Expected result: the subtask order in the reply JSON is B, A, C
Actual result: the order is A, B, C

Note that the 'issue' REST method returns sub-tasks in a correct order.
fields.summary: Subtasks are returned in the wrong order from the search REST API method

*How:*

Ismael
fields.summary: SLA for each Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43186].
  {panel}

At the moment, Log Work entry will be recorded and shown under *Work Log* tab, as shown below
!first.png|thumbnail!

When user edits the entered work log, the previous value is no longer stated. neither under *History* tab nor *Work Log* tab. The previous value is also not recorded in the database, (as the new value has replaced it in _worklog_ table). The entry in _changeitem_ table only records the worklog ID instead of the value the user entered. 
!second.png|thumbnail!

It would be better to have the previous value recorded and shown under *Work Log* tab, as other changes recorded under *History* tab.
fields.summary: Keep the history of the previous WorkLog entered

fields.description: When logging work on a issue before estimating it,  the Remaining estimate continue set to 0 after estimating
fields.summary: Remaining estimate not changing
Add the ability to disable verbose error messages output in the browser

fields.description:
Ran into an apparent bug on our self-hosted instance of JIRA. When we added the 'security level' field to our screens, no users (including users with project roles that can "set issue security" in the permission scheme editor) could see the Security Level field and using the "Where's my field?" function returned a status of:

bq. The 'Security Level' field is not present on the form you are viewing

with a description of:

bq. The 'Security Level' field is not included in the 'Default User Story Screen' screen configured for this issue. To solve this problem, go to 'Default User Story Screen' Screen configuration settings and add the field.

The screen configurations were all correct - the field should have been showing.

We were able to get around this by creating a custom single-line text field also called "Security Level" with some random text as a default value, making both visible on the default screen scheme, and then hiding the dummy custom field. This made the real field visible on-screen and work as expected.
fields.summary: 'Security Level' field hidden even when set to 'shown' on field configurations
Managing Project Permissions so that project admins do not have rights to add groups in projects
